message: Hi Bob, I'm selling a product that I think you'd be very interested in. It's worth a lot to me, so I'm asking for $12,000. Let me know what you think!
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $9,000. Is that something you'd be willing to consider?
Bob, I appreciate your offer, but $9,000 is a bit too low for me. I'm willing to come down to $10,500. This is a good deal for both of us. Let's make this happen!
I'm still interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $9,500. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I don't think I can go any higher than that. Can you consider that?

Bob, I understand you're trying to get the best price, and I'm happy to work with you.  But I'm not comfortable going below $10,000. This is a high-quality product, and I'm confident it's worth that to you. Let's meet in the middle and make this deal happen!
I'm getting close to accepting, but I think I can do better than $10,000. How about $9,800? I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I really think I can get a better deal than that.

Bob, I appreciate your persistence, but I'm still not comfortable going below $10,000. This is a one-time opportunity for you to get this product, and I'm confident it's worth every penny.  Let's close this deal.

I understand that you're confident in the product's value, but I'm still trying to be responsible with my budget. I'm willing to meet you at $9,500, but that's as high as I can go. Please consider it.
